description: From Middle French auspice, from Latin auspicium, in turn from auspex.

entries.meaning: (chiefly in the plural) Patronage or protection.
examples: This building was built under the auspices of the Friends of the Poor.
The circle of vultures was not a good auspice.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Divination from the actions of birds.

verbs.description: auspice (third-person singular simple present auspices, present participle auspicing, simple past and past participle auspiced)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To be patron of; to sponsor.
